intro: Sahashia stricta, commonly known as the rigid sahashia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, unbranched stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, and it has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Sahashia stricta thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, and it is often found in areas with well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical studies.
